title: Linotype
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223073522/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Foundries](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223073522/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Foundries) : Linotype**

Founded in 1997, Linotype GmbH is a wholly-owned subsidiary of [Monotype Imaging Inc.](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223073522/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Monotype%20Imaging%20Inc.). Linotype is the current member of a long line of Linotype corporations. Previous Linotype corporations had purchased or merged with many of their competitors, including [D. Stempel AG](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223073522/http:/typophile.com/wiki/D.%20Stempel%20AG), [Deberny and Peignot](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223073522/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Deberny%20and%20Peignot), [Haas](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223073522/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Haas), and the [Dr.-Ing Rudolf Hell GmbH](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223073522/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Dr.-Ing%20Rudolf%20Hell%20GmbH).

The first Linotype entity ( [Mergenthaler Linotype](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223073522/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Mergenthaler%20Linotype)) was founded in New York in 1890 by a German immigrant to the United States, [Ottmar Mergenthaler](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223073522/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Ottmar%20Mergenthaler), who had invented the first commercially viable typsetting machine in 1886, the [Linotype Machine](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223073522/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Linotype%20Machine).

Located today in Bad Homburg, Germany, Linotype's website is [Linotype.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223073522/http:/www.linotype.com/). The digital foundry distributes over 6,000 fonts, including most of the typefaces designed by [Adrian Frutiger](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223073522/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Adrian%20Frutiger) and [Hermann Zapf](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223073522/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Hermann%20Zapf). Other popular typefaces include [Helvetica](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223073522/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Helvetica), [Syntax](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223073522/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Syntax), [Sabon](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223073522/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Sabon), [Compatil](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223073522/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Compatil), and [Vialog](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223073522/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Vialog).

Linotype's Managing Director is [Frank Wildenberg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223073522/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Frank%20Wildenberg); the Type Director is [Akira Kobayashi](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223073522/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Akira%20Kobayashi).

From 1997–2006, Linotype GmbH (1997–2005 under the name "Linotype Library GmbH") was a wholly-owned subsidiary of [Heidelberger Druckmaschinen AG](http://web.archive.org/web/20150223073522/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Heidelberger%20Druckmaschinen%20AG).
